content.title: Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS)
content.description: Catheter-based ultrasound imaging providing cross-sectional views of vessel wall and lumen from within the vessel.
content.mechanism: Rotating ultrasound transducer (20-40 MHz) on catheter tip provides 360° vessel wall imaging

venous_disease.advantages: Identifies stenoses missed by venography, better stent sizing
venous_disease.critical_role: Standard of care in iliac vein stenting

arterial_disease.dissection: Identifies true vs false lumen, extent

evar_fevar.sizing: More accurate than CT for device sizing

content.statement: Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS) is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Diagnostics Intraoperative that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS) helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS) include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS).
